messages.content: What does the ComfyUI_wav2lip folder contain?
The ComfyUI_wav2lip folder contains filelists for the new evaluation framework proposed in the paper, specifically for the test sets of LRS2, LRS3, and LRW datasets.
What are the three datasets included in the ComfyUI_wav2lip filelists?
The three datasets included in the ComfyUI_wav2lip filelists are LRS2, LRS3, and LRW.
What does the LRS2 and LRW filelists contain?
The LRS2 and LRW filelists contain a list of names of audio-video pairs from the test sets of LRS2 and LRW datasets.
What is the copyright status of the LRS2 and LRW filelists?

The LRS2 and LRW filelists are strictly 'Copyright BBC' and can only be used for 'non-commercial research by applicants who have an agreement with the BBC to access the Lip Reading in the Wild and/or Lip Reading Sentences in the Wild datasets'.
Where can one find more details about accessing the LRS2 and LRW datasets?
More details about accessing the LRS2 and LRW datasets can be found at the following link: https://www.bbc.co.uk/rd/projects/lip-reading-datasets.
What does the ReSynCED sub-folder contain?
The ReSynCED sub-folder contains filelists for the Real-world lip-Sync Evaluation Dataset (ReSyncED).
Where can instructions on how to use the filelists be found?
Instructions on how to use the filelists are available in the README of the parent folder.
